entry.title: AI and .NET: Exploring the AI samples repo and the model evaluation sample
entry.summary:
Hi, and welcome to the recap of our latest video on AI and .NET.
In this video, we talked about some of the exciting projects and samples that we have been working on to help you get started with AI using .NET. We also answered some of the questions that you asked us in the previous episode, such as:
How to work with local models How to use semantic kernel How to evaluate different models.
One of the main topics that we discussed was the AI samples repo, where we are adding artificial intelligence samples for .NET developers. You can find scenarios such as text summarization, chat, data generation, image generation, and more. You can also choose between using semantic kernel or the Azure Open AI SDK to interact with the models.
We also showed you how to switch between different models, such as GPT-4, Phi-3 and Llama, using the same code and API. We also shared some links to other resources, such as the Azure Developer .NET Day, where you can learn more about AI, GitHub Copilot, SQL Server, and other topics.
Another topic that we covered was the model evaluation sample, which is a work in progress that we are going to present at Build 2024. (you can check the PR here). The idea behind this sample is to help you evaluate different models that you may want to use or fine-tune for your own applications. We showed you how to use a console application that uses semantic kernel to generate questions and answers, user stories, and other inputs, and then evaluate them using different metrics, such as coherence, groundedness, relevance, and length.
The full recording is here,
Check the next sessions here: .NET Live.
Best, Bruno

entry.title: How to install intl extension on WordPress on Azure App Service
entry.summary: 1.Run the following code in the App Service SSH - apk add icu-dev && \ docker-php-ext-configure intl && \ docker-php-ext-install intl && \ docker-php-ext-enable intl 2. Now copy the intl.so & docker-php-ext-intl.ini file to persistent storage located under /home - mkdir /home/intl-ext cp /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/docker-php-ext-intl.ini /home/intl-ext/docker-php-ext-intl.ini cp /usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20220829/intl.so /home/intl-ext/intl.so 3.Insert the following code into the "/home/dev/startup.sh" file - apk add icu-dev cp /home/intl-ext/docker-php-ext-intl.ini /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/docker-php-ext-intl.ini cp /home/intl-ext/intl.so /usr/local/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20220829/intl.so supervisorctl restart php-fpm 4. After completing the previous steps, restart your App Service. Once restarted, navigate to phpinfo.php and verify that the intl extension is successfully installed.

entry.title: Startup Showcase: Cleverdist
entry.summary:
ZoomIn3D GenAI-Enabled Voice-Controlled 3D User Interface Cleverdist have developed a system that allows users to monitor and control infrastructure through connecting to camera streams, creating triggers, and using computer vision. The system integrates artificial intelligence for operational use.
Founders Hub Benefits What level are they? Graduated from the program. What benefits have they been using? prototyping fast and with scale using Azure Cleverdist is a startup that has already graduated from the Founders' Hub program but were able to take advantage of the benefits. They utilized essential resources like GPUs and AI tools to power their product. ZoomIn3D Product Demo
Cleverdist has robust capabilities, including the use of multiple microphones and the integration of multimodality to interact with AI models. These features allow users to execute tasks such as repositioning cameras through natural language commands, with an intuitive and user-friendly interface. The ability to craft triggers from control system inputs, schedules, and computer vision has enabled actions such as alarm activation and report generation, streamlining operations and enhancing productivity. Connect with Robert Gomez-Reino, CEO at Cleverdist Join Microsoft for Startups Founders' Hub today! Interested in taking your startup to the next level? The Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub unlocks a world of possibilities for budding entrepreneurs, offering complimentary access to advanced AI technologies via Azure. Participants can benefit from up to $150,000 in Azure credits, personalized mentorship from seasoned Microsoft professionals, and a wealth of additional resources. This initiative is designed to be inclusive, welcoming individuals with a vision to innovate, without the prerequisite of prior funding. Apply to Founders' Hub today to reap the benefits.

entry.title: Analyse browser-side performance with Web Driver Sampler on Azure Load Testing
entry.summary: Introduction Performance testing is not always a walk in the park. Quite often, it can be challenging and time-consuming, especially when dealing with complex and dynamic web applications that rely on JavaScript, AJAX, or other browser-side technologies. For testing browser latencies under heavy load, JMeter has a built-in component called Web Driver Sampler, which allows testers to use Selenium WebDriver to simulate real browser actions and interactions with web elements. Web Driver Sampler can complement the HTTP Request Sampler, which sends HTTP requests to the server, by adding the browser-side perspective and measuring the rendering time, page load time, and user actions. By running JMeter scripts on Azure Load Testing, you can reliably execute your performance tests without worrying …

entry.title: Virtual Network Flow Logs Recipes
entry.summary:
You might have heard about the General Availability of Virtual Network Flow Logs in Azure, and even read the announcement blog post. When writing that post with Harsha CS I had the chance to play a bit with VNet Flow Logs and Traffic Analytics, and I would like to share some of the learnings.
What the heck am I talking about? Let me bring you up to speed very quickly (attention, oversimplification ahead!): NSG Flow Logs is a technology that logs every packet going through an NSG: in and out, allowed and dropped. The main issue of NSG Flow Logs is, well, that you need an NSG, and some resources in Azure do not support them. For example, Azure Firewall, VPN gateways or ExpressRoute gateways. Enter VNet Flow Logs, which you can enable in a whole VNet or subnet, regardless of whether there…

entry.title: Automatic Memory Fit for Java Apps in Azure Container Apps
entry.summary:
Introduction Containerization has become the prevailing choice for hosting and managing Java applications, due to its unmatched portability, consistency, and scalability benefits. However, by default, when running a Java app inside containers, the JVM assumes that the OS memory is shared among multiple applications, so it conservatively claims memory for the Java application. With Azure Container Apps, we can optimize memory allocation by simply dedicating more memory to the Java app, since only one Java application can run inside a container. This feature is called automatic memory fit, which is enabled by default when you deploy from Java source code or artifact. In this blog we’ll cover the following:
Highlight Java memory management terms and concepts Discuss how automatic memory fit …

entry.title: IPv6 to IPv4 workload communication
entry.summary: As organizations begin to convert new and existing IPv4 workloads to IPv6, they will need to manage communications between these different IP versions. This article provides an overview of three common Azure workload scenarios organizations need to plan for, and how to execute by leveraging the dual-stack nature of Azure networks. Azure IPv6 enabled services are deployed in a dual-stack configuration that allows them to maintain both IPv4 addresses and IPv6 addresses. These IPv4 do not need to be unique inside of the private network. entry.title: How to Refresh Expired Keys in Redis using Azure Functions
entry.summary:
Introduction Redis is an extremely popular in-memory data store that is used as a cache, session store, message broker, and more. One of the features that makes Redis really useful is the ability to set a time-to-live (TTL) value for any key. A key with a TTL value will be automatically deleted from Redis when the TTL expires. This helps reduce memory usage and ensure data freshness.
For instance, you might be storing information like inventory or pricing for your e-commerce site in Redis. This is a perfect application for caching in Redis. This type of data will be queried constantly and serving it directly from a database will either slow down your application or make your database implementation very expensive to handle the load! Using a CDN is out of the question because pricing and …

entry.title: Basic understanding on Microsoft Entra custom claims provider
entry.summary:
TOC
What is it Architecture How to use it References
What is it When a user authenticates to an app (e.g., MS Entra ID application), a custom claims provider can be used to add claims into the token. A custom claims provider is made up of a custom authentication extension that calls an external REST API (e.g., a Function App), to fetch claims from external systems (e.g., a Database). A custom claims provider can be assigned to one or many applications.
Claim: Please imagine it as features (or attributes) that belong to the end user. As it may involve sensitive information within the enterprise, the enterprise owner wishes to store this user information in the on-premises environment, while also hoping to retrieve and utilize it through the authentication process.

entry.title: Azure VMware Solution now available in Italy North, Switzerland North and UAE North
entry.summary:
Azure VMware Solution has recently expanded availability to Italy North, Switzerland North and UAE North
We are pleased to announce we recently expanded to three more regions: Italy North, Switzerland North and UAE North. Now in 32 Azure regions, Azure VMware Solution empowers you to seamlessly extend or migrate existing VMware workloads to Azure without the cost, effort or risk of re-architecting applications or retooling operations.
Azure VMware Solution supports:
Rapid cloud migration of VMware-based workloads to Azure without refactoring. Datacenter exit while maintaining operational consistency for the VMware environment. Business continuity and disaster recovery for on-premises VMware environments. Attach Azure services and innovate applications at your own pace. Includes the VMware technology stack and lets you leverage existing Microsoft licenses for Windows Server and SQL Server.
For updates on current and upcoming region availability, visit the product by region page here.
Streamline migration with new offers and licensing benefits, including a 20% discount.
We recently introduced the VMware Rapid Migration Plan, where Microsoft provides a comprehensive set of licensing benefits and programs to give you price protection and savings as you migrate to Azure VMware Solution. Azure VMware Solution is a great first step to the cloud for VMware customers, and this plan can help you get there. Learn More

HDInsight on AKS allows you to deploy popular Open-Source Analytics workloads like Apache Spark™, Apache Flink®️, and Trino without the overhead of managing and monitoring containers. For more information about Azure HDInsight on AKS, see the documentation.

entry.summary: ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

entry.title: Public preview: Azure Backup supports long term retention for backup of Azure Database for MySQL– Flexible Server
entry.summary: Now you can retain backups for up to 10 years by defining your own backup and retention policy for MySQL- Flexible server.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Backup enables vaulted backups for Azure Files for comprehensive data protection.
entry.summary: Azure Backup now supports transferring Azure Files backups to the vault for comprehensive protection against severe data loss scenarios like ransomware attack.

entry.title: Long Audio API will be retired on 31 March 2027 – Migrate to the new batch synthesis API
entry.summary: Long Audio API will be retired on March 31, 2027

entry.title: Custom .Net deserializer for Azure Stream Analytics will be retired on 30 September 2024.
entry.summary: Custom .Net deserializer for Azure Stream Analytics will be retired on 30 September 2024.

entry.title: General availability: Availability zone volume placement for Azure NetApp Files
entry.summary: Deploy new Azure NetApp Files volumes in Azure availability zones (AZs) of your choice to support workloads across multiple availability zones

entry.title: GA: Improved throughput performance on Azure Disks’ Standard SSD
entry.summary: Azure Disks Standard SSD throughput limits are now 100 MB/s on disks sized 8191 GBs and lower.

entry.title: GA: Azure Logic Apps Designer for Consumption
entry.summary: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of the new Azure Logic Apps Designer for Consumption, revolutionizing your workflow experience with unparalleled speed, smoothness, and reliability. Unifying the designer experience across all supported platforms, including standard Azure Logic Apps, the Azure Logic Apps Visual Studio Code extension, and consumption Azure Logic Apps in the portal, ensures seamless usability and familiarity wherever you work.

entry.title: Public Preview: Safety evaluations for generative AI applications in Azure AI Studio
entry.summary: Measure your generative AI application’s susceptibility to jailbreak attacks and to producing unsafe content, so you can implement effective mitigations and go from prototype to production with confidence.

entry.title: GA: Azure SQL Trigger support for Azure Functions
entry.summary: You can now build application logic in Azure Function apps which can be driven by the data from Azure SQL database

entry.title: Public preview: Support for Key Vault Certificates in Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: You can now use Azure Key Vault to store and manage your own TLS/SSL certificates for use with Azure Container Apps.

entry.title: Generally Available: Free managed certificates on Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: Azure Container Apps now provides a free managed certificate for your custom domain.

entry.title: Public preview: PowerShell 7.4 support for Azure Functions
entry.summary: You can now develop apps using PowerShell 7.4 locally and deploy them to Azure Functions

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Container Apps OpenTelemetry collector support
entry.summary: You can now use open-source standards to send your app’s data.

entry.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for late-March 2024
entry.summary: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-March 2024 .

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for late-March 2024
entry.summary: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-March 2024.

entry.title: Public Preview: Real-time text translation using the azure_ai extension in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: Text translation right within SQL facilitates building intelligent multilingual applications on Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

entry.title: Public Preview: Invoke Azure Machine Learning models using the azure_ai extension
entry.summary: Invoke Azure Machine Learning models in real-time from SQL in Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

entry.title: General availability: Migration service in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: Seamlessly migrate PostgreSQL to Azure using a managed service for complete schema and data transfers, hassle-free.

entry.title: General availability: Rate Limiting on ExpressRoute Direct Circuits
entry.summary: Rate Limiting is now generally available over ExpressRoute Direct port circuits, providing enhanced control over bandwidth usage. This Quality of Service (QoS) feature prevents circuits from bursting beyond their configured bandwidth, thereby improving network performance and reliability. Rate Limiting can be enabled for each circuit individually, offering flexibility to prioritize certain circuits. This feature can be activated during or after the creation of the ExpressRoute Direct circuit.

entry.title: Public preview: Change partition key of a container in Azure Cosmos DB (NoSQL API)
entry.summary: The ability to change the partition key of a container in Azure Cosmos is now available in preview for NoSQL API.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL Database Mirroring in Microsoft Fabric
entry.summary: Mirroring Azure SQL Database provides an easy experience to continuously replicate SQL DB data directly into Microsoft Fabric.

entry.title: Azure Static Web Apps distributed functions capability now in Public Preview
entry.summary: Reduced latency by distributing managed functions to regions of high demand.

entry.title: Breaking Changes to Azure API Management Workspaces
entry.summary:
As part of our commitment to enhancing workspaces (in Public Preview) within Azure API Management, we are implementing several critical breaking changes effective June 14, 2024. These changes are designed to streamline functionality and improve overall performance.
These breaking changes will be effective from June 14, 2024. We strongly advise making any necessary adjustments to your workspace configurations before this date to ensure uninterrupted service.

entry.title: General Availability: Automatic Scaling for App Service Web Apps
entry.summary: Azure App Service is pleased to announce general availability of the "Automatic Scaling" feature.

entry.title: Preview: New Features in Azure Container Storage
entry.summary: Azure Container Storage is a fully managed volume orchestration service built natively for containers. New capabilities include support for Temp SSD, simplified installation via AKS CLI, and scalable storage for cost-efficient workload management.

entry.title: Important Notice: Azure Product Retirement: End of Life Announcement of Azure Maps Creator Feature State Service Versions 31 March 2025
entry.summary: Azure Maps Creator Feature State Service will be retired on 31 March 2025.

entry.summary: Support for Standard_M192ims_v2 will be retired on 31 March 2027.

entry.summary: Support for Standard_M192is_v2 will be retired on 31 March 2027.

entry.summary: Azure HDInsight 4.0 will be retired on 31 March 2025 - migrate your HDInsight clusters to 5.1

entry.title: General Availability: Azure Files geo-redundancy for standard large file shares
entry.summary: Azure Files geo-redundancy for 100TiB standard SMB file shares is now generally available.

entry.title: Private Preview: Force detach zone redundant disks during zone outage
entry.summary: Force detach zone redundant disks during zone outage and take advantage of ZRS ability to achieve an RPO of 0.

entry.title: General Availability: Azure NetApp Files support for 1 TiB capacity pools
entry.summary: Azure NetApp Files now supports smaller 1 TiB capacity pool sizes, lowered from 2 TiB, when used with volumes using standard network features.

entry.title: Public Preview: Next generation of general purpose service tier for Azure SQL Managed Instance
entry.summary: The next generation of general purpose service tier brings improved performance, 32 TB storage and higher database density.

entry.title: Public preview: Public IP Domain Name Label Scope
entry.summary: Announcing the public preview for a new capability in Azure public IP address that can prevent DNS subdomain takeover while still allowing for re-use of DNS names.

entry.title: Public preview: Database watcher for Azure SQL
entry.summary: Enable in-depth, managed monitoring of Azure SQL databases, elastic pools, and managed instances.

entry.title: Generally available: Application Gateway (v2) IPv6 support
entry.summary: Azure Application Gateway v2 enables dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) connectivity from the clients, providing more flexible and reliable access to the backend Applications.

entry.title: General availability: Listener TLS certificates management in the Azure portal
entry.summary: You can now manage the TLS certificates associated with Listeners through Azure portal.

entry.title: Operator and CRD support with Azure Managed Prometheus
entry.summary: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus will support CRD-based configs for scrape jobs to collect metrics from workloads running in your AKS cluster. With this new update, customers can use custom resources (service monitor and pod monitor) to configure metric collection with Managed Prometheus.

entry.title: Microsoft open sources Retina: A cloud-native container networking observability platform
entry.summary: The Microsoft's Azure Container Networking team is announcing Retina, a cloud-native container networking observability platform that enables Kubernetes users, admins, and developers to visualize, observe, debug, and analyze Kubernetes’ workload traffic irrespective of Container Network Interface (CNI), operating system (OS), and cloud.

entry.title: Billing for Azure Monitor stateful log search alerts
entry.summary: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.

entry.title: Public preview: Kubernetes AI Toolchain Operator (KAITO) add-on for AKS
entry.summary: You can now choose from preset LLMs with images hosted by AKS and split inferencing across multiple lower-GPU count VMs

entry.title: Generally Available: Cost analysis add-on for AKS
entry.summary: You can now better understand the infra costs associated with running applications at the namespace and cluster levels and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization through an Azure native experience.

entry.title: Generally Available: Windows Gen 2 VM support in AKS
entry.summary: YOu can now use Gen 2 VM SKUs for Windows nodepools in AKS.

entry.title: Public preview: Windows GPU support in AKS
entry.summary: You can now run GPU workloads, such as machine learning, video encoding, large simulations, and gaming, on Windows nodepools in AKS.

entry.title: Generally Available: Kubernetes 1.29 support in AKS
entry.summary: You can now take advantage of Kubernetes 1.29 version with AKS in production environment.

entry.title: Generally Available: Custom kubelet configuration for Windows in AKS
entry.summary: You can now modify default values for kubelet parameters when using Windows nodepools in AKS.

entry.title: Public preview: Azure CNI static block IP allocation support in AKS
entry.summary: You can now scale beyond the current 65k Pod IPs and scale up to 1 Million Pods.

entry.title: Public preview: Deployment safeguards in AKS
entry.summary: You can now use deployment safeguards to implement Kubernetes best practices and get warnings on deployment or deny the deployment of manifest files that are not following best practices.

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure CNI overlay dual stack Support in AKS (Linux only)
entry.summary: You can now deploy AKS clusters in dual stack mode which now enables resource connection through IPv4 or IPv6.

entry.title: Generally Available: VM IP based load balancer in AKS
entry.summary: You can now choose IP-based backend pool membership for new or existing clusters in AKS.

entry.title: Generally Available: Host Network Security Group (NSG) control in AKS
entry.summary: You can now directly configure allowed ports in your nodepool settings.

entry.title: Generally Available: HostPort auto assign in AKS
entry.summary: AKS now lets you deploy pods without manually specifying host ports.

entry.title: Generally Available: Instance level Public IP tags in AKS
entry.summary: You can now utilize Azure routing preference for your cluster, public node IPs in AKS

entry.title: Public preview: Trusted launch support in AKS
entry.summary: Administrators can now deploy AKS nodes with verified and signed bootloaders, OS kernels, and drivers.

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) support for 5K Node limit by default for standard tier clusters
entry.summary: You can now scale your AKS cluster to larger than 1000 nodes without having to request any special limit increases or whitelisting.

entry.title: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase.
entry.summary: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase, which provides an easy way to continue getting reservation discounts.

entry.title: Billing for Azure Monitor stateful log search alerts
entry.summary: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.

entry.title: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping
entry.summary: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping for Prometheus instance served with TLS. To enable TLS and mTLS based scraping, you can configure the TLS settings in the ConfigMap.

entry.title: Azure IoT Edge supports Ubuntu Core Snaps
entry.summary: We are expanding the Azure IoT Edge supported platforms to include Ubuntu Core Snaps on IoT Edge as a Tier 1 supported operating system.

entry.title: Now available: Free data transfer out to internet when leaving Azure
entry.summary: Learn how to qualify for free egress when moving your data out of Azure.

entry.title: Public Preview: JVM memory fit in Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: Java apps are now attuned to the container environment and primed for better performance and reliability by default.

entry.title: Public Preview: Managed Java components in Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: You can now leverage managed Java components in Azure Container apps for service registry and externalized application properties.

entry.title: Public Preview: Tomcat support in Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: You can now deploy a Java application using a WAR file to Azure Container Apps.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for mid-March 2024
entry.summary: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-March 2024.

entry.title: General Availability: Azure Defender for Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
entry.summary: Defender for Cloud detects anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases. When deployed, it provides another important security barrier.

entry.title: General Availability: Private Link in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore

entry.summary: Major version upgrade logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now generally available.

entry.summary: Utilize an additional Enterprise-tier cache size to optimize the price and performance of your Redis workload.

entry.summary: Now you can use Microsoft Entra ID authentication on Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters in addition or instead of the native Postgres authentication.

entry.title: Announcing Try Azure Cosmos DB support in Vercel Integration
entry.summary: We're excited to announce Try Azure Cosmos DB support in our Azure Cosmos DB integration with Vercel.

entry.title: WhatsApp Business Platform now available for applications built on Azure
entry.summary: Azure Communication Services Advanced Messaging is now generally available, enabling developers to send and receive messages from their applications through third party social messaging platforms, like the WhatsApp Business Platform. This latest messaging service helps businesses create intelligent B2C communication workflows to reach more customers at scale and deliver safe, reliable communications to customers worldwide.

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure Chaos Studio supports new fault for Azure Event Hubs
entry.summary: Azure Chaos Studio supports new faults for Azure Event Hubs.

entry.title: Azure API Center Updates
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce an update to the Azure API Center extension for Visual Studio Code, introducing new capabilities for API inventory and design. Additionally, we are unveiling a new API governance feature in API Center, enabling API linting and analysis based on customer-owned design guidelines.

entry.title: Generally available: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier in Poland Central, Qatar Central and Azure China
entry.summary: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier in generally available in Poland Central, Qatar Central and Azure China.

entry.title: General Availability: App Service Backup and Restore over Azure Virtual Network
entry.summary: Customers can now use custom backups, to back up their web app's files and configuration data to a firewall-protected storage account.

entry.title: Generally available: Service Level Agreements on Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier
entry.summary: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier has published Service Level Agreements.

entry.title: General availability: Azure Virtual Network encryption now in additional regions
entry.summary: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines. Now available in additional regions.

entry.title: Public preview: Change Actor
entry.summary: Change Actor allows you to see who initiated the change and with which client that change was made, for changes across all your tenants and subscriptions.

entry.title: Generally available: Azure Functions Support for Node.js 20
entry.summary: Develop functions using Node.js 20 locally and deploy them to all Azure Functions plans on Linux and Windows.

entry.title: Public preview: Internet inbound for Network Virtual Appliances in Virtual WAN Hubs
entry.summary: Public preview for internet inbound (Destination NAT) capabilities for Next-Generation Firewall Network Virtual Appliances deployed in the Virtual WAN hub. Destination NAT allows network administrators to publish applications to the broader internet through a public IP address assigned to a Firewall Network Virtual Appliance deployed in a Virtual WAN hub.

entry.summary: You can deploy an officially supported Istio addon for AKS

entry.title: Public preview: Disable network policy in AKS for migration
entry.summary: You can now temporarily disable your network policy engines to perform a migration.

entry.title: Public preview: AKS support for node soak duration for upgrades

entry.title: General availability: Azure SDKs support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: Now you can use Azure SDKs including .NET SDK, Go SDK, Java SDK, JavaScript SDK, and Python SDK to manage the lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters.

entry.title: General availability: Azure CLI support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: You can now use Azure CLI to manage the whole lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters from provisioning to scaling to configuration changes and starting/stopping cluster compute.

entry.title: General availability: Application Gateway for Containers
entry.summary: Application Gateway for Containers is the next evolution to Application Gateway's Ingress Controller; bringing performance, scale, deployment, and feature enhancements.

entry.title: Enable replication for added VMware VM data disks
entry.summary: Azure Site Recovery now supports enabling replication for data disks that you add to a VMware VM that's already enabled for disaster recovery.

entry.title: GA: Azure API Management Developer Portal Unveils Enhanced Features for Increased Developer Productivity
entry.summary: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.

entry.title: Public preview: Azure Application Gateway introduces support for TLS and TCP protocols
entry.summary: TLS and TCP protocol support now available through Azure Application Gateway.

entry.title: Announcing NBCROW Compression in Kusto's TDS Implementation
entry.summary: A new feature that reduces the data transfer for MSSQL queries on Kusto.

entry.title: Sending a log search alert with cross tenant target resource will no longer be supported
entry.summary: As of March 15, 2024, this behavior will change and sending a log search alert with a cross tenant target resource (except for the lighthouse case) will no longer be supported. Alerts will not be sent to unauthorized target resources, and log search alert rules with an unauthorized target will be ignored. This will ensure that only authorized users can receive and investigate log search alerts.

entry.title: Update records in a Kusto Database (public preview)
entry.summary: The new .update command allows you to update records (rows) in a Kusto Database (either in Azure Data Explorer or in Fabric KQL Database). This is a new tool to help you build great data pipeline!

entry.title: Public Preview: Regional Disaster Recovery by Azure Backup for AKS

entry.summary: Customization enables developers to efficiently configure workstations to their exact project requirements, within guardrails set by admins that enforce governance and security policies.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Storage Actions — Serverless storage data management
entry.summary: Azure Storage Actions is a fully managed platform that helps you automate data management tasks for Azure Blob Storage and Azure Data Lake Storage.

entry.summary: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Ultra disks in Azure Backup.

entry.summary: General availability for the support for Azure VMs using Premium SSD v2 in Azure Backup.

entry.title: Execute Azure Monitor Logs connector on exact time range provided dynamically (preview)
entry.summary: Azure Monitor Logs connector lets you query data in your Log Analytics workspace or Application Insights components per Logic App trigger or schedule, and list or visualize results. The Time range…

entry.title: Generally available: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier support on Change Feed and Object Replication
entry.summary: Azure Blob Change Feed and Object Replication now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.

entry.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for mid-February 2024
entry.summary: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-February 2024.

entry.title: General availability: Customer managed key encryption for Enterprise tier caches
entry.summary: Encrypt Redis persistence files using customer managed keys.

entry.title: Public preview: Migration service in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: Easily migrate PostgreSQL to Azure with a managed service supporting full schema and data migrations, without complexity.

entry.title: Public preview: Azure SQL migration assessment enabled by Azure Arc
entry.summary: With SQL Server enabled by Azure Arc you can now begin your migration journey from directly within the Azure Arc environment with recommended Azure SQL deployment option that best fits your workload needs.

entry.title: Azure Firewall: Flow Trace Logs and Autoscaling based on number of connections are now generally available
entry.summary: Flow Trace Logs provide more visibility into the TCP handshake, providing insight into whether traffic is properly flowing through the firewall. In addition, Azure Firewall can now autoscale based on number of connections, providing more scaling adaptability to dynamic workloads.

entry.title: Azure Firewall: Parallel IP Group update support is now in public preview
entry.summary: Parallel IP Group support enables administrators to simultaneously update multiple IP Groups in a firewall, streamlining the process of implementing devOps changes.

entry.title: Sending a log search alert to unauthorized target resources will no longer be supported
entry.summary: When a log search alert rule is configured with a target resource for which the alert process does not have access or permissions, the rule has an unauthorized target resource. As of Mar 15,2024, sending a log search alert to unauthorized target resources is no longer supported.

entry.title: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available
entry.summary: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available, the industry’s first fully managed and cloud-native SAN offering that simplifies deploying, scaling, managing, and configuring a SAN in the cloud.

entry.title: Public preview: Upgrade policies for Virtual Machine Scale Sets using Flexible Orchestration
entry.summary: Upgrade Policies for Virtual Machine Scale Sets using Flexible Orchestration provide a safe and consistent method to keep your scale set instances up-to-date.

entry.title: Public preview: AKS cluster control plane metrics in managed Prometheus
entry.summary: You can now monitor the health, load and performance of the API server and etcd in the control plane of your AKS clusters

entry.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in Canada Central
entry.summary: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the Canada Central region.

entry.title: General availability: Improvements in Azure Key Vault
entry.summary: Improvements in Azure Key Vault: FIPS 140-2 Level 3, PCI DSS and PCI 3DS certified for all customers.

entry.title: General Availability: Application consistent restore points supports Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks
entry.summary: Application consistent restore points supports Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes in US Gov Regions
entry.summary: Azure NetApp Files in US Gov region now supports ability to edit existing ANF volumes and upgrading Basic network features to Standard network features.

entry.title: Azure Ultra Disk Storage is now available in Canada East
entry.summary: Now available in Canada East region, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.

entry.title: General availability: Topology
entry.summary: Enhancing network and resource health visualization with unified and dynamic topology across subscriptions, regions, and resource groups integrated with actionable connectivity and traffic insights.

entry.title: Mount Azure Storage as a local share in App Service Linux Now supports NFS
entry.summary: NFS support is now available for App Service Linux code and container when mounting a Azure File share as a local share for the web app.

entry.title: Announcing General Availability to migrate Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer Cluster to Private Endpoints
entry.summary: The migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints in generally available now. The process is simple and can be done using the Azure portal, the ARM template, or any code which uses the ADX SDK.

entry.title: Support for log alert rules that use cross-workspace queries with resource names or qualified name identifiers will be retired on 31 May 2024
entry.summary: As of May 31, 2024, log alert rules will no longer support cross-workspace queries that use resource names or qualified name identifiers.

entry.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager security admin rule generally available in 30 regions
entry.summary: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 30 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.

entry.title: Private Preview: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs (Windows OS)
entry.summary: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure Stack HCI latest feature release
entry.summary: Azure Stack HCI is the Microsoft Azure Arc-enabled infrastructure. Now, customers who have an Azure Stack HCI subscription can download the latest feature release for their infrastructure. This new Azure Stack HCI release is the version of the product required to run Azure Virtual Desktop on- prem which is also now in GA and called Azure Virtual Desktop for Azure Stack HCI. This is an exciting development as the public preview of this product is in high demand specifically in Healthcare and Financial Services.

entry.title: Generally Available: Continuous model monitoring in Azure Machine Learning

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor introduces Prometheus community recommended alerts
entry.summary: Enable Prometheus community recommended alerts to monitor key signals to be promptly notified on potential critical issues within your clusters.

entry.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API
entry.summary: General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data plane API We are excited to share Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API is Now Generally Available! Unlock enhanced insights into the monitoring of your Azure resources with our powerful API. Explore its features and elevate your monitoring experience today!

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure API Center – January Updates
entry.summary: Azure API Center is your one-stop solution for inventorying and managing your organization’s APIs. In this update, we are bringing you new features and improvements to help you discover, reuse, and consume your APIs more easily and efficiently. These features are designed to help you streamline your API lifecycle, improve your developer experience, and increase your API adoption.

entry.title: Public preview: Istio add-on for AKS now supports plug-in certificate authority (CA)

entry.title: Generally Available: Support for Cross Region Restore for PostgreSQL backups

entry.title: Public preview: Upgrade support in Istio add-on for AKS

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Functions Support for Java 21 on Linux

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure Container Apps supports additional TCP ports

entry.title: Generally Available: Kube-reserved resource optimization in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
entry.summary: You will see AKS reserve up to 20% less memorry on nodes.

entry.title: General availability: PgAudit in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
entry.summary: Database session and object audit logging of database activities in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL.

entry.title: General Availability: Read replica in special regions with Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
entry.summary: Read replica now available in Microsoft Azure operated by 21Vianet and Azure Government regions.

entry.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for late-January 2024
entry.summary: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-January 2024.

entry.title: General Availability: Server logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
entry.summary: Enhance your database monitoring with the new server log feature for Azure Database for PostgreSQL, offering customizable retention and straightforward downloading for operational excellence.

entry.title: Public preview: Azure SQL updates for late-January 2024
entry.summary: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-January 2024.

entry.title: General availability: Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL Customer-managed keys (CMK)
entry.summary: Customer-managed keys allow you to use your own key for cluster data encryption at rest.

entry.title: General availability: Israel Central region added to Azure HDInsight
General availability: Italy North region added to Azure HDInsight
Use Streaming Ingestion to Azure Data Explorer with Azure Stream Analytics
entry.summary: Use Streaming Ingestion to output data to Azure Data Explorer with Azure Stream Analytics

entry.title: Improved exports experience
entry.summary: Introducing an improved exports experience that makes FinOps easier and more efficient with access to additional datasets and optimized for handling large data. You can also create and manage your exports with a few clicks, download your cost data in FOCUS format, and maintain compatibility with previous schema versions, enhance your security and compliance while saving time and money.

entry.title: Generally available: Up to 50 test fail criteria in Azure Load Testing
entry.summary: You can now specify up to 50 test criteria in your load test.

entry.title: Azure Red Hat OpenShift January 2024 updates
entry.summary: Azure Red Hat OpenShift now offers Resource Health for clusters with integration with Azure Monitor via Signals and Alerts.

entry.title: New Features for graph-match KQL Operator: Enhanced Pattern Matching and Cycle Control
entry.summary: The graph-match operator in Kusto Query Language (KQL) allows you to query your data as a graph and find matches for a specified pattern. The latest update introduces two new features: the cycles parameter and the nonlinear patterns. These features enable you to control how cycles are matched and express more complex and flexible patterns in your graph queries.

entry.title: Automatic Image Creation using Azure VM Image Builder is now generally available
entry.summary: We’re happy to announce automatic image creation using Azure Image Builder is now generally available. This feature improves your speed and efficiency by allowing you the ability to start image builds for new base images automatically.

entry.title: General availability: Azure Data Explorer adds new geospatial capabilities
entry.summary: Kusto now has three new geospatial functions: geo_polygon_to_h3cells(), geo_angle() and geo_azimuth(). These functions are designed to help you better understand and analyze your geospatial data.

entry.title: Generally Available: Azure Monitor VM Insights Dependency Agent support for RHEL 8.6 Linux VMs
entry.summary: Azure Monitor VM Insights now supports Dependency Agent for RHEL 8.6 Linux VMs, enabling you to monitor their network connections and processes in the Azure portal.

entry.title: Azure Advisor integration with Azure Monitor Log Analytics Workspace
entry.summary:
Advisor is a personalized cloud consultant that helps you follow best practices to optimize your Azure deployments.
It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry and then recommends solutions that can help you improve the cost effectiveness, performance, Reliability, and security of your Azure resources.
We in Azure Monitor believe that observability should be cost effective, and we want to help our customers control their cost, operational excellence, performance, reliability, and security of their Azure resources. This, in turn, helps grow their overall satisfaction with, and usage of Azure.
We have introduced several cost optimization related recommendations and added Azure Advisor to the Log Analytics Workspace admin experience. more recommendations are on the way.

entry.title: Public Preview: Circuit Breaker in Azure API Management
entry.summary: Customers now have the capability to configure the circuit breaker property in the backend resource, providing protection for a backend service against being overwhelmed by excessive requests.

entry.title: Public Preview: Load Balancer in Azure API Management
entry.summary: Customers have the ability to create a load balancer that directs traffic to multiple endpoints.

entry.title: Azure Spring Apps Feature Update Q4 2024: Spring Cloud Gateway supports a response cache and more
entry.summary: Recent updates to the Enterprise plan include improved response caching in Spring Cloud Gateway, a more secure try-out option in API Portal, and enhanced application-level settings in Service Connector. Additionally, there's richer build history information to help with troubleshooting. For both Enterprise and Basic/Standard plans, Azure Spring Apps now offer scheduled maintenance for updates and an auto-sync feature for certificates, making application management more efficient and secure.

entry.title: Private Preview: Upgrade existing Azure Gen1 VMs to Gen2-Trusted launch
entry.summary: Support to upgrade existing Gen1 VMs to Trusted launch in preview.

entry.title: General Availability: Azure Database for MySQL Import feature for Azure Database for MySQL Single to Flexible Server migrations
entry.summary: Easily migrate your Azure Database for MySQL – Single Server workloads to Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server with Azure Database for MySQL Import.

entry.title: General Availability: Azure MySQL Import feature for Azure Database for MySQL Single to Flexible Server migrations
entry.summary: Easily migrate your Azure Database for MySQL – Single Server workloads to Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server with Azure MySQL Import.

entry.title: Public preview: Partition merge now supports shared throughput databases
entry.summary: You can now merge partitions in Azure Cosmos DB on shared throughput databases. Merging partitions allows you to reduce the number of physical partitions used for your container.

entry.title: General Availability: Azure Virtual Network encryption
entry.summary: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines.

entry.title: General Availability: Customer-managed keys for Azure NetApp Files volume encryption
entry.summary: Azure NetApp Files volumes supports encryption with customer-managed keys (CMK), using Azure Key Vault for key storage, to enable an extra layer of security for data at rest.

entry.title: General Availability: Premium SSD v2 and Ultra disks support with Trusted launch
entry.summary: Trusted launch VMs now support Azure Premium SSD v2 and Ultra disks storage.

entry.title: Public Preview: Azure Data Explorer connector for Apache Flink
entry.summary: Azure Data Explorer connector for Apache Flink (Public Preview)

entry.title: Azure Ultra Disk Storage is now available in UK West and Poland Central
entry.summary: Now available in the UK West and Poland Central regions, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.

entry.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in more regions
entry.summary: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the West US3 and Germany West Central regions.
